Babies who are very small are 
nursed in incubators rather 
than cots to keep them warm. 
However, you can still have a 
lot of contact with your baby. 
Some incubators have open 
tops. If not, you can put your 
hands through the holes in 
the side of the incubator and 
touch your baby. When your 
baby is stable, the nurses will 
be able to help you take your 
baby out of the incubator and 
show you how to have skin-
to-skin contact. You should 
carefully wash and thoroughly 
dry your hands b
